issue.description:
justification_support_item does not include properties. It should include: Activity_property Assigned_property
Mappings and MIM to be extended to match.

comment.description: justification_support_item also extended to include Resource_property

issue.description: Cannot state the type of person and other requirements for a position or position_type. Suggest extending tsr_required_resource_item to include position and position_type.
Need to extend state_definition_of_item select type to include Activity_method and Applied_activity_method_assignment.
Need to add to tsr_documented_element_select to include Activity_property to allow, for exmaple, the source document for a property to be recorded.
Need to add to location_assignment and position_type_assignment to select.

The select condition_item contains: Task_assignment Task_method_relationship Task_relationship
Surely condition_evaluation_item should contain something to do with TASK?
The module should use from condition_evaluation.
As this is the first point at which ap239_product_definition_information gets brought in, condition_evaluation_item should also contain activity_property.

comment.description: Condition_parameter included here, condition_evaluation_parameter extended in Ap239_activity_recording.

issue.description: Need to extend type_of_person select to include person. This is to make it possible to assert that a person is of a given type. Note that it is possible here but maybe could be done elsewhere (such as in the type_of_person module?).

Probably better to specify Applied_activity_method_assignment here rather than Task_assignment. This opens up properties in the cases where Activity_method is being used in a general way - as a type of Activity as well as when it is a Task or Scheme.
Need to be able to extend identification to Type_of_person, Qualification, Type_of_expereince and Position_in_organisation.

comment.description: done - also other characterizations added to elements of these modules where necessary - see below

issue.description: Need to characterize Type_of_person, Qualification, Experience, Position_in_organization and Type_of_organization.

It should be possible to have an Activity_property and Activity_property_representation as parameters to a condition. Extend the condition_evaluation_parameter_item and condition_parameter_item selects accordingly.
Add the characterization of Activity_property and Resource_property entities. Should include i.e. classification_assignment (See ap_239_properties).
It should be possible to assign a state_definition to a Task.

comment.description: applied to the general types of Activity_method and Appled_activity_method_assignment after discussion

issue.description: Add Resource_item to the extensible select work_output-item. An output could be a resource that's not defined as a product/part etc, i e Power (?).
Add Person to the extensible select required_resource_item. "A box of pencils (resource) is required by Leif Gyllstrom on the 10th of Oct" (?).

comment.description: Rejected. This should be done using a dummy task for consistency and flexibility.

issue.description: Missing mapping for Task_assignment and Task_method_assignment

The product_group entities need to be characterized. The Product_group should have the following assigned: approval, certification, classification, contract, date, document, person_organization, project, condition_item
Product_group_relationship should have the following assigned: approval, certification, classification, contract, date, document, person_organization, condition_item
Product_group_membership should have the following assigned: approval, classification, date, document, person_organization, condition_item
Use from location_assignment_characterized.
Add qualification_assignment to tsr_identification_item
organization_or_person_in_organization_item does not include position_type

description.p: It should be possible to assign a Task to a Product_version_relationship. Example: The removal of a piece of equipment is a Task that involves a Product_as_realized in the context of its installation in a greater context (another Product_as_realized). A Product_version_relationship connects the two individual products and should, thus, be assigned the Task. Add Product_version_relationship to Activity_method_item.

comment.description: The use of Product_version_relationship is inappropriate in this situation. You should use View_definition_relationship or View_definition_usage instead. tsr_task_item includes view_definition_relationship so you can assign a task to it.

description.p: It should be possible to assign a Task to a type of organization. Currently Tasks can only be assigned to individual organizations. Add Organization_type to Activity_method_item. Alternatively, introduce an Organization_type_assignment.

issue.description:
Extend approval_item to include: Position_group_assignment Position_position_type_assignment Position_type_assignment Required_resource_assignment Resource_as_realized_assignment
Extend date_or_date_time_item to include: Position_assignment Position_group_assignment Position_position_type_assignment Position_type_assignment Required_resource_assignment Resource_as_realized_assignment
Extend organization_or_person_in_organization_item to include: Position_assignment Position_group_assignment Position_position_type_assignment Position_type_assignment Required_resource_assignment Resource_as_realized_assignment Type_of_person_assignment
Information_rights needs to be applied to task.
Task needs to be the target of STATE_OBSERVED, in order to track the lifecycle of the definition of the task.
The prefix "tse" should be "tsr" to be consistent with the rest of the module.
The assignment capabilities of Activity, Activity_method, Task and Scheme should be rationalised and made consistent with each other, and with the Resource and Work_output modules.

description.p: The question is when to use applied_activity_assignment V work_output?

Applied activity assignment is recommended to be used by the PDM schema when recording the results of a configuration change. The approach is to classify Applied activity assignment as "Activity_input" is the product state before the change, "Activity_output" is the product state after the change.
Therefore Work_output should be used to record any output from a task or activity that does not result in the change to the product status.
For example, the waste oil that results from a task is related to the activity_actual performing the task and is related by work_output
The various selects for activity_assignment, work_output and resource_item need to be checked.

comment.description: Rationalized under the direction of Nigel Shaw

description.p: According to the current model, Task can not be assigned to Product_version_relationship. Instead a View_definition_relationship shall be created and the Task assigned to it.
Update the documentation of the model accordingly, that is, specifically for Task.

comment.description: Add Product_version_relationship to actvit_item select. Agreed with Norwegian representative to BCR workshop, Seattle, October 2004.
Further discusion superceding Shaw 2004-10-18, the select will not be extended, but, following the original proposed solution, the usage appropriate will be added to usage guidence in DEXLIB.

description.p: It should be possible to assign identifiers to Product_based_location_identifications. It should also be possible to classify Product_based_location_identifications, both attributes.
Include Product_based_location_identification in Identification_item, Classification_item, and Classified_attribute_select (at least those three).
Discussed in BCR workshop. Add Product_based_location_identification to Classification_item, identification_item and classified_attribute_select selects.

comment.description: Shouldn't all the location representations be classified and identified. Not just Product_based_location_identification? Location has now been modified so that there is an explicit abstract supertype "Location_representation" rather than the select location_representation. Therefore, Location_representation should be classified, identified, and have a date time assigned.
Now created supertype location_representation and made all location_representation subtypes. See RBN-10 and RBN-EXS-5 RBN-11 RBN-12 for the resulting select extensions.
Resolved as per auxilliary issues as RBN-10,11,12,exs-5, plus completed other relevent extensions and added multi-lingual support for location.
